##After "Ten thousand Arrows Pierce the heart" , what kind of "anti-epidemic drama" Does Wuhan Need?

Micro-signal wzshck

Function description, how wonderful, this earthly life.

Click on the above material life reference Plus Star!
Material life reference

By Peng Liangjie
Source: Material Life Reference (ID: WZSHCK)

01.

At an awards ceremony for Arrow through the heart, executive producer and art consultant Xie Fei thanked Fang Fang. Adapted from Fang Fang's novel of the same name, Arrow through the heart is considered one of the best films about Wuhan in recent years, both for its universal pain and its connection to the city's cultural life.

At nearly 80 years old, Xie Fei was a representative of the fourth generation of Chinese directors, and one of the three directors whom Jiang Wen admired most, namely Xie Jin and herself. Xie Fei has said some things about domestic films that movie people may want to say but are afraid to say.

"It's been 60 years since I made a stupid movie, " he said last year.

Another: "I've always had a desire to make something that mattered in times of turmoil, and I haven't done it yet, " says Xie Fei, who studied with Xie Jin, the latter's representative work, Hibiscus Town, is exactly what it means to be a "weighty work" .

Xie Fei said this in 2003, when he was admitted to Ditan Hospital for treatment of an unfortunate infection during the SARS epidemic, and appeared on an interview program a few months after his release. At that time, "not yet" , 17 years later, he still did not realize the desire, now retreat to the second line, will focus on the new director, to find a good script.

Recently, the reclusive Xie Fei has been spending a lot of time at home, posting his ratings and reviews on Weibo, a popular Chinese drama, as well as Hollywood blockbuster the joker. Although he is not high on the South Korean new film "The ministers of Namsan" evaluation, but a look at its light: South Korean films are really dare to shoot anything!

A few days ago, he dug out the newspaper report that year that he was discharged from the hospital, lamented on Weibo: Seventeen years, the epidemic is repeated.

In 2004, a news report showed that Xie Fei was preparing a TV series about SARS, all named crisis of a hundred days. Xie Fei said he wanted to make the point that it's not the illness that's scary, it's the mental illness that's the most deadly. But it didn't work out.

I wonder if this time he will re create the idea of making an anti plague drama, and work with Fang Fang again after Arrow through the heart.

In fact, the production of the new crown's anti plague drama is already in the planning stages, written not by Fang Fang but by another woman, Liu Liu. Recently, Yaoke media announced on its official Weibo account that the first TV series with a comprehensive anti-epidemic theme has been launched and named together. The guiding spirit and method are as follows:

It's not like the creative team isn't strong. There are two specific names: Screenwriter Liu Liu and director Zhang Li. Their representative works, "Snail House" and "the Ming Dynasty" , which were born in the same period, were once covered with the meaning of "can not be said" and became the Weathervane of the standard of speech in the Times of change.

Liu Liu, who wrote the hit TV series "home alone, " and who wrote the medical drama "the art of the heart" a few years ago, should have no problem "creating heroic images of ordinary people fighting the epidemic. ". After Liu Liu arrived in Wuhan on March 8, She, like Fang Fang, updated her diary on Wechat's public account, recently provoked outrage when she said: It's a good thing I'm here, there's no more material.

The words "fortunately" and "material" hurt a lot of people.

She uses the words "my duty" and "my duty to the world" in the title. Unlike Fang Fang's sharp recriminations, the "material" in her diary is full of warmth, with many leaving messages reminding her that "there is no need to sing the praises of people now" ; On the other side of the question, she arrived at the end of the epidemic, with no real experience of the heartbreak experienced by the people of Wuhan a month ago. Will the unwitnessed depictions of suffering and the glorification of sacrifice be profound?

Screenwriter Liu Liu specializes in urban family dramas, while director Zhang Li specializes in historical dramas.

Zhang Li's two masterpieces, the Ming Dynasty and the Towards the Republic, both scored 9.7 points in Douban to establish his position as "the first director of Chinese drama" . Some say that "game of thrones" can only be called "power fight" in front of "the Ming Dynasty" , others say "the Ming Dynasty" "illustrates the institutional texture of corruption" , in contrast to "the name of the people" is only skin deep.

Who would have thought, "the Ming Dynasty" was also the "proposition composition. In 2003, a prominent Chinese leader visited Hainan and told the provincial leader: Why doesn't Hainan Promote Hai Rui? Throughout history, Hai Rui has been popular for his image as a man of integrity. This sentence became the beginning of the creation of the Ming Dynasty.

If you look closely, the end of each episode might bear this out.

It was reported that the authorities at that time adopted a very rare form of censorship. The leaders and experts of the "major historical topics censorship office" of the State Administration of Radio, Film and Television (SARFT) reviewed the material at a rate of 14 episodes per day. Among them were elderly people in their 70s who sat for more than 10 hours a day, 46 episodes in three and a half days. 1. Get through the trial.

However, Zhang Li, who more than a decade ago wrote an extraordinary "essay on proposition" , has recently given audiences an ancient puppet show starring Yang Yang, a graduate of the People's Liberation Army Academy of Art School, with less than half the ratings of the Ming Dynasty.

From Liu Liu, who wrote dwelling narrowness, to Liu Liu, who wrote home, from Zhang Li, who wrote the Ming Dynasty, to Zhang Li, who wrote Wugonggan Kun, what should people expect from this anti epidemic drama?

02.

Reference to the SARS background of the film and Television Works, in addition to Xie Fei failed to go, "100 days crisis" , in fact, many.

At the time, the most talked about film was 38 degrees, a love story in which popular movie stars Huang Lei and Tao Hong played a work study delivery graduate student and a beautiful young flight attendant, who were shut down because of SARS, a love story in which two people are forced to live apart. Both actors were given the job for nothing.

Another anti-epidemic film, "Thrill, " is one of those movies where the school organizes everyone to watch, one commented: "from the system to all walks of life involved in the fight against the epidemic, to all links of implementation is perfect, only understanding and support, cooperation, no loopholes, no tragedy, self-experience. "

"shock and awe" is one of the three "shock series" produced by the August First Film Studio. The other two are "The Perfect Storm" , which tells the story of fighting the floods in 1998, and "shock and Awe" , which tells the story of the Wenchuan County earthquake, can Be said to be the typical shooting style of chinese-style disaster documentary.

Other works such as "SARS life" , "21 days" , "war without gunpowder" and so on, few people know, it can be seen that the realistic value and artistic vitality of these works is very limited. Only the five-episode documentary "the 10th anniversary of SARS" by Phoenix satellite TV, which has more than nine minutes on Douban, has been revived by many in the outbreak.

Maybe it's because you don't have a good script.

The 1980s and 1990s were the Golden Age of Chinese cinema, Xie Fei says, when many good screenplays came from good literature, but now young people see literature less. He also said, "Great Writers and works are those that make a critical discovery of life or ask questions, that question sharply the State of Human Existence, that have value, but not much, in simply extolling the beauty and glory of life. "

There are many literary works worthy of film and TV production, for example, another Wuhan writer wrote a novel about SARS, but regret still became "indescribable" . People also lost the opportunity to see this literary work on screen.

But former readers have not forgotten. Someone on Weibo quoted a line from the book: When they don't let you say it, it proves you're telling the truth.

As reality gradually dawned on people, the demands of the anti-epidemic drama were simple: Even if China's "Chernobyl" could not be made, at least it should not be sensationalized to cover up the mistakes that could have been made, don't exude the complacency of "man has conquered the virus" . Unfortunately, Liu Liu has begun displaying in her diary the exorbitant prices for flights to China from abroad.

Some people in the preparation of the anti-epidemic drama of the micro-blog, the recommendation should be all of Hubei, especially Wuhan Actors to play, but there are many things more important than the actor's hometown.

According to the producers, "there are plans for 20 episodes, each with a separate story for two episodes, " meaning 10 stories. How do you choose between these 10 stories? Since this is a national participation "people's war" , then by the National Netizens vote to see the top 10 events as a blueprint, perhaps the best choice. It saved Liu Liu the trouble of going to Wuhan to study what people would like to see, as some news reports have done in detail. The only problem is that if the National People's vote, the highest vote event is unlikely to be released.

And the story of the Wuhan Filmmaker Herself -- a film studio employee named Chang Kai, a family of four who died in 12 days. Whether can Wuhan Film and Television bound choose oneself to record?

During the War of Resistance Against Japan, Lao She's one act play in defense of Wuhan caused a sensation. At the time, Wuhan was the nation's political and Cultural Center, a golden age of authorship, recorded in Wuhan, 1938: war, refugees, and the making of modern China. One of the most interesting lessons from this story, says one, is that power shifts provide a short window in which free media can flourish. Three

The Golden Age, directed by Ann Hui and starring the Republican woman writer Xiao Hong, makes reference to this history. Xiao Hong completed the first two chapters of his magnum opus the legend of the Blue River while living in Wuhan, where the film was shot in numerous scenes. Although she was in the left wing camp, Xiao Hong was not interested in grand themes, and her focus on individual suffering led her to a different path from that of Ding Ling, another woman writer whose ambition was to write for the revolution.

03.

Beyond Ann Hui, the sixth generation of Chinese directors has a soft spot for Wuhan.

After the previous film was banned, Lou Ye's Mystery is set in Wuhan, "to film the details of life, and Wuhan's urban structure, rivers and atmosphere, very suitable for the story" ; "Party at the southern station" director Diao Yinan originally intended to shoot in Guangzhou, but after a survey found too few lakes, finally chose Wuhan, "to stay there for two days, we are finalized" ; Wang Xiaoshuai came to Wuhan with his parents for a few years when he was 13, and loved the Yangtze River and the bridge in Wuhan, "When I was a child, I learned to draw, and I rode my bicycle from the Chinese workers to Minzhu road by the river, and then I took a ferry across the river, " said So Close to Paradise, who shot his film in Wuhan and visited the city to explore the scenery.

In the sixth generation of directors, rivers and lakes, as well as the Yangtze River Bridge built on it, the ferry terminal is never absent from the urban landscape, but their film in Wuhan People's face is insubstantial.

Jia Zhangke, who is originally from Shanxi Province, is not only good at telling stories about his hometown, but also at making the city look like something more than the place where the story takes place. He always aimed his camera at the water level of the Three Gorges Reservoir area, as if the rising water submerged the dwelling place and the city, and also buried an era under the water.

Wuhan and Chongqing, both known as Wuhan, drink from the same river and have many similarities of their own. In his essay Wuhan, Fang Fang wrote:

Wuhan's culture has a strong local flavor, and when it is mixed with the commercial vulgarity that permeates the city, it gives people a feeling of local customs. But thanks to the Yangtze River, it is the Yangtze River that fills the city with a natural vigorous atmosphere.

But after the disaster, "we can not go back to the original Wuhan, " said Kohiki, a Wuhan poet. "The disaster has marked every Wuhan, and everyone who survived has written on their bodies that they survived. ". Wuhan of the future may be like Chongqing, carrying a heavy symbol of the times to go down, along with rivers, lakes and seas into the city's blood.

When I watched the southern station party, the format of the opening credits struck me as strange, but I couldn't put my finger on what was strange at the time. Later, when I read the reviews, some people said it looked like a tombstone with a person's name on it. That's true.

The Eulogy of the Eulogy, the reflection of the reflection, the memorial ceremony. At least don't make the audience cry for nothing.

Reference:
1. The Central Commission for Discipline Inspection took part in the bidding of the Ming Dynasty to promote Hai Rui's anti corruption spirit, source: Chinanews.com
2. Wuhan writer Hu Fayun by Ding Xing
3. Wuhan 1938, the war between culture and the masses source: single reading
4. In Wuhan, a poet no longer writes poetry source: characters

* Images from the Internet and video capture

Reply "Fan" , enter material life fan group,
Get exclusive quality living reference.

Bamboo shoots in March, a Minute to Win It adventure

Would you like to buy a whistle?

Don't try to stop me. I'M GONNA get some Liuzhou Vermouth

- END -

01.

At an awards ceremony for Arrow through the heart, executive producer and art consultant Xie Fei thanked Fang Fang. "It's been 60 years since I made a stupid movie, " he said last year.

Another: "I've always had a desire to make something that mattered in times of turmoil, and I haven't done it yet, " says Xie Fei, who studied with Xie Jin, the latter's representative work, Hibiscus Town, is exactly what it means to be a "weighty work" .

Xie Fei said this in 2003, when he was admitted to Ditan Hospital for treatment of an unfortunate infection during the SARS epidemic, and appeared on an interview program a few months after his release. At that time, "not yet" , 17 years later, he still did not realize the desire, now retreat to the second line, will focus on the new director, to find a good script.

03.

"The disaster has marked every Wuhan, and everyone who survived has written on their bodies that they survived. ". * Images from the Internet and video capture

01.

At an awards ceremony for Arrow through the heart, executive producer and art consultant Xie Fei thanked Fang Fang. Adapted from Fang Fang's novel of the same name, Arrow through the heart is considered one of the best films about Wuhan in recent years, both for its universal pain and its connection to the city's cultural life.

Xie Fei said this in 2003, when he was admitted to Ditan Hospital for treatment of an unfortunate infection during the SARS epidemic, and appeared on an interview program a few months after his release. At that time, "not yet" , 17 years later, he still did not realize the desire, now retreat to the second line, will focus on the new director, to find a good script.

Among them were elderly people in their 70s who sat for more than 10 hours a day, 46 episodes in three and a half days. 1. Get through the trial.

However, Zhang Li, who more than a decade ago wrote an extraordinary "essay on proposition" , has recently given audiences an ancient puppet show starring Yang Yang, a graduate of the People's Liberation Army Academy of Art School, with less than half the ratings of the Ming Dynasty.

From Liu Liu, who wrote dwelling narrowness, to Liu Liu, who wrote home, from Zhang Li, who wrote the Ming Dynasty, to Zhang Li, who wrote Wugonggan Kun, what should people expect from this anti epidemic drama?

At an awards ceremony for Arrow through the heart, executive producer and art consultant Xie Fei thanked Fang Fang. Adapted from Fang Fang's novel of the same name, Arrow through the heart is considered one of the best films about Wuhan in recent years, both for its universal pain and its connection to the city's cultural life.

At nearly 80 years old, Xie Fei was a representative of the fourth generation of Chinese directors, and one of the three directors whom Jiang Wen admired most, namely Xie Jin and herself. Xie Fei has said some things about domestic films that movie people may want to say but are afraid to say.

"It's been 60 years since I made a stupid movie, " he said last year.

Another: "I've always had a desire to make something that mattered in times of turmoil, and I haven't done it yet, " says Xie Fei, who studied with Xie Jin, the latter's representative work, Hibiscus Town, is exactly what it means to be a "weighty work" .

Xie Fei said this in 2003, when he was admitted to Ditan Hospital for treatment of an unfortunate infection during the SARS epidemic, and appeared on an interview program a few months after his release. At that time, "not yet" , 17 years later, he still did not realize the desire, now retreat to the second line, will focus on the new director, to find a good script.

Recently, the reclusive Xie Fei has been spending a lot of time at home, posting his ratings and reviews on Weibo, a popular Chinese drama, as well as Hollywood blockbuster the joker. Although he is not high on the South Korean new film "The ministers of Namsan" evaluation, but a look at its light: South Korean films are really dare to shoot anything!

A few days ago, he dug out the newspaper report that year that he was discharged from the hospital, lamented on Weibo: Seventeen years, the epidemic is repeated.

In 2004, a news report showed that Xie Fei was preparing a TV series about SARS, all named crisis of a hundred days. Xie Fei said he wanted to make the point that it's not the illness that's scary, it's the mental illness that's the most deadly. But it didn't work out.

I wonder if this time he will re create the idea of making an anti plague drama, and work with Fang Fang again after Arrow through the heart.

In fact, the production of the new crown's anti plague drama is already in the planning stages, written not by Fang Fang but by another woman, Liu Liu. Recently, Yaoke media announced on its official Weibo account that the first TV series with a comprehensive anti-epidemic theme has been launched and named together. The guiding spirit and method are as follows:

It's not like the creative team isn't strong. There are two specific names: Screenwriter Liu Liu and director Zhang Li. Their representative works, "Snail House" and "the Ming Dynasty" , which were born in the same period, were once covered with the meaning of "can not be said" and became the Weathervane of the standard of speech in the Times of change.

Liu Liu, who wrote the hit TV series "home alone, " and who wrote the medical drama "the art of the heart" a few years ago, should have no problem "creating heroic images of ordinary people fighting the epidemic. ". After Liu Liu arrived in Wuhan on March 8, She, like Fang Fang, updated her diary on Wechat's public account, recently provoked outrage when she said: It's a good thing I'm here, there's no more material.

The words "fortunately" and "material" hurt a lot of people.

She uses the words "my duty" and "my duty to the world" in the title. Unlike Fang Fang's sharp recriminations, the "material" in her diary is full of warmth, with many leaving messages reminding her that "there is no need to sing the praises of people now" ; On the other side of the question, she arrived at the end of the epidemic, with no real experience of the heartbreak experienced by the people of Wuhan a month ago. Will the unwitnessed depictions of suffering and the glorification of sacrifice be profound?

Screenwriter Liu Liu specializes in urban family dramas, while director Zhang Li specializes in historical dramas.

Zhang Li's two masterpieces, the Ming Dynasty and the Towards the Republic, both scored 9.7 points in Douban to establish his position as "the first director of Chinese drama" . Some say that "game of thrones" can only be called "power fight" in front of "the Ming Dynasty" , others say "the Ming Dynasty" "illustrates the institutional texture of corruption" , in contrast to "the name of the people" is only skin deep.

Who would have thought, "the Ming Dynasty" was also the "proposition composition. In 2003, a prominent Chinese leader visited Hainan and told the provincial leader: Why doesn't Hainan Promote Hai Rui? Throughout history, Hai Rui has been popular for his image as a man of integrity. This sentence became the beginning of the creation of the Ming Dynasty.

If you look closely, the end of each episode might bear this out.

It was reported that the authorities at that time adopted a very rare form of censorship. The leaders and experts of the "major historical topics censorship office" of the State Administration of Radio, Film and Television (SARFT) reviewed the material at a rate of 14 episodes per day. Among them were elderly people in their 70s who sat for more than 10 hours a day, 46 episodes in three and a half days. 1. Get through the trial.

However, Zhang Li, who more than a decade ago wrote an extraordinary "essay on proposition" , has recently given audiences an ancient puppet show starring Yang Yang, a graduate of the People's Liberation Army Academy of Art School, with less than half the ratings of the Ming Dynasty.

From Liu Liu, who wrote dwelling narrowness, to Liu Liu, who wrote home, from Zhang Li, who wrote the Ming Dynasty, to Zhang Li, who wrote Wugonggan Kun, what should people expect from this anti epidemic drama?

02.

Reference to the SARS background of the film and Television Works, in addition to Xie Fei failed to go, "100 days crisis" , in fact, many.

At the time, the most talked about film was 38 degrees, a love story in which popular movie stars Huang Lei and Tao Hong played a work study delivery graduate student and a beautiful young flight attendant, who were shut down because of SARS, a love story in which two people are forced to live apart. Both actors were given the job for nothing.

Another anti-epidemic film, "Thrill, " is one of those movies where the school organizes everyone to watch, one commented: "from the system to all walks of life involved in the fight against the epidemic, to all links of implementation is perfect, only understanding and support, cooperation, no loopholes, no tragedy, self-experience. "

"shock and awe" is one of the three "shock series" produced by the August First Film Studio. The other two are "The Perfect Storm" , which tells the story of fighting the floods in 1998, and "shock and Awe" , which tells the story of the Wenchuan County earthquake, can Be said to be the typical shooting style of chinese-style disaster documentary.

Other works such as "SARS life" , "21 days" , "war without gunpowder" and so on, few people know, it can be seen that the realistic value and artistic vitality of these works is very limited. Only the five-episode documentary "the 10th anniversary of SARS" by Phoenix satellite TV, which has more than nine minutes on Douban, has been revived by many in the outbreak.

Maybe it's because you don't have a good script.

The 1980s and 1990s were the Golden Age of Chinese cinema, Xie Fei says, when many good screenplays came from good literature, but now young people see literature less. He also said, "Great Writers and works are those that make a critical discovery of life or ask questions, that question sharply the State of Human Existence, that have value, but not much, in simply extolling the beauty and glory of life. "

There are many literary works worthy of film and TV production, for example, another Wuhan writer wrote a novel about SARS, but regret still became "indescribable" . People also lost the opportunity to see this literary work on screen.

But former readers have not forgotten. Someone on Weibo quoted a line from the book: When they don't let you say it, it proves you're telling the truth.

As reality gradually dawned on people, the demands of the anti-epidemic drama were simple: Even if China's "Chernobyl" could not be made, at least it should not be sensationalized to cover up the mistakes that could have been made, don't exude the complacency of "man has conquered the virus" . Unfortunately, Liu Liu has begun displaying in her diary the exorbitant prices for flights to China from abroad.

Some people in the preparation of the anti-epidemic drama of the micro-blog, the recommendation should be all of Hubei, especially Wuhan Actors to play, but there are many things more important than the actor's hometown.

According to the producers, "there are plans for 20 episodes, each with a separate story for two episodes, " meaning 10 stories. How do you choose between these 10 stories? Since this is a national participation "people's war" , then by the National Netizens vote to see the top 10 events as a blueprint, perhaps the best choice. It saved Liu Liu the trouble of going to Wuhan to study what people would like to see, as some news reports have done in detail. The only problem is that if the National People's vote, the highest vote event is unlikely to be released.

And the story of the Wuhan Filmmaker Herself -- a film studio employee named Chang Kai, a family of four who died in 12 days. Whether can Wuhan Film and Television bound choose oneself to record?

During the War of Resistance Against Japan, Lao She's one act play in defense of Wuhan caused a sensation. At the time, Wuhan was the nation's political and Cultural Center, a golden age of authorship, recorded in Wuhan, 1938: war, refugees, and the making of modern China. One of the most interesting lessons from this story, says one, is that power shifts provide a short window in which free media can flourish. Three

The Golden Age, directed by Ann Hui and starring the Republican woman writer Xiao Hong, makes reference to this history. Xiao Hong completed the first two chapters of his magnum opus the legend of the Blue River while living in Wuhan, where the film was shot in numerous scenes. Although she was in the left wing camp, Xiao Hong was not interested in grand themes, and her focus on individual suffering led her to a different path from that of Ding Ling, another woman writer whose ambition was to write for the revolution.

Reference to the SARS background of the film and Television Works, in addition to Xie Fei failed to go, "100 days crisis" , in fact, many.

At the time, the most talked about film was 38 degrees, a love story in which popular movie stars Huang Lei and Tao Hong played a work study delivery graduate student and a beautiful young flight attendant, who were shut down because of SARS, a love story in which two people are forced to live apart. Both actors were given the job for nothing.

Another anti-epidemic film, "Thrill, " is one of those movies where the school organizes everyone to watch, one commented: "from the system to all walks of life involved in the fight against the epidemic, to all links of implementation is perfect, only understanding and support, cooperation, no loopholes, no tragedy, self-experience. "

"shock and awe" is one of the three "shock series" produced by the August First Film Studio. The other two are "The Perfect Storm" , which tells the story of fighting the floods in 1998, and "shock and Awe" , which tells the story of the Wenchuan County earthquake, can Be said to be the typical shooting style of chinese-style disaster documentary.

"

Unfortunately, Liu Liu has begun displaying in her diary the exorbitant prices for flights to China from abroad.

It saved Liu Liu the trouble of going to Wuhan to study what people would like to see, as some news reports have done in detail. The only problem is that if the National People's vote, the highest vote event is unlikely to be released.

During the War of Resistance Against Japan, Lao She's one act play in defense of Wuhan caused a sensation. At the time, Wuhan was the nation's political and Cultural Center, a golden age of authorship, recorded in Wuhan, 1938: war, refugees, and the making of modern China. One of the most interesting lessons from this story, says one, is that power shifts provide a short window in which free media can flourish. Three

The Golden Age, directed by Ann Hui and starring the Republican woman writer Xiao Hong, makes reference to this history. Xiao Hong completed the first two chapters of his magnum opus the legend of the Blue River while living in Wuhan, where the film was shot in numerous scenes. Although she was in the left wing camp, Xiao Hong was not interested in grand themes, and her focus on individual suffering led her to a different path from that of Ding Ling, another woman writer whose ambition was to write for the revolution.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
03.

Beyond Ann Hui, the sixth generation of Chinese directors has a soft spot for Wuhan.

After the previous film was banned, Lou Ye's Mystery is set in Wuhan, "to film the details of life, and Wuhan's urban structure, rivers and atmosphere, very suitable for the story" ; "Party at the southern station" director Diao Yinan originally intended to shoot in Guangzhou, but after a survey found too few lakes, finally chose Wuhan, "to stay there for two days, we are finalized" ; Wang Xiaoshuai came to Wuhan with his parents for a few years when he was 13, and loved the Yangtze River and the bridge in Wuhan, "When I was a child, I learned to draw, and I rode my bicycle from the Chinese workers to Minzhu road by the river, and then I took a ferry across the river, " said So Close to Paradise, who shot his film in Wuhan and visited the city to explore the scenery.

In the sixth generation of directors, rivers and lakes, as well as the Yangtze River Bridge built on it, the ferry terminal is never absent from the urban landscape, but their film in Wuhan People's face is insubstantial.

Jia Zhangke, who is originally from Shanxi Province, is not only good at telling stories about his hometown, but also at making the city look like something more than the place where the story takes place. He always aimed his camera at the water level of the Three Gorges Reservoir area, as if the rising water submerged the dwelling place and the city, and also buried an era under the water.

Wuhan and Chongqing, both known as Wuhan, drink from the same river and have many similarities of their own. In his essay Wuhan, Fang Fang wrote:

Wuhan's culture has a strong local flavor, and when it is mixed with the commercial vulgarity that permeates the city, it gives people a feeling of local customs. But thanks to the Yangtze River, it is the Yangtze River that fills the city with a natural vigorous atmosphere.

But after the disaster, "we can not go back to the original Wuhan, " said Kohiki, a Wuhan poet. "The disaster has marked every Wuhan, and everyone who survived has written on their bodies that they survived. ". Wuhan of the future may be like Chongqing, carrying a heavy symbol of the times to go down, along with rivers, lakes and seas into the city's blood.

When I watched the southern station party, the format of the opening credits struck me as strange, but I couldn't put my finger on what was strange at the time. Later, when I read the reviews, some people said it looked like a tombstone with a person's name on it. That's true.

The Eulogy of the Eulogy, the reflection of the reflection, the memorial ceremony. At least don't make the audience cry for nothing.

Beyond Ann Hui, the sixth generation of Chinese directors has a soft spot for Wuhan.

After the previous film was banned, Lou Ye's Mystery is set in Wuhan, "to film the details of life, and Wuhan's urban structure, rivers and atmosphere, very suitable for the story" ; "Party at the southern station" director Diao Yinan originally intended to shoot in Guangzhou, but after a survey found too few lakes, finally chose Wuhan, "to stay there for two days, we are finalized" ; Wang Xiaoshuai came to Wuhan with his parents for a few years when he was 13, and loved the Yangtze River and the bridge in Wuhan, "When I was a child, I learned to draw, and I rode my bicycle from the Chinese workers to Minzhu road by the river, and then I took a ferry across the river, " said So Close to Paradise, who shot his film in Wuhan and visited the city to explore the scenery.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Wuhan and Chongqing, both known as Wuhan, drink from the same river and have many similarities of their own. In his essay Wuhan, Fang Fang wrote:

Wuhan's culture has a strong local flavor, and when it is mixed with the commercial vulgarity that permeates the city, it gives people a feeling of local customs. But thanks to the Yangtze River, it is the Yangtze River that fills the city with a natural vigorous atmosphere.

But after the disaster, "we can not go back to the original Wuhan, " said Kohiki, a Wuhan poet. "The disaster has marked every Wuhan, and everyone who survived has written on their bodies that they survived. ". Wuhan of the future may be like Chongqing, carrying a heavy symbol of the times to go down, along with rivers, lakes and seas into the city's blood.

When I watched the southern station party, the format of the opening credits struck me as strange, but I couldn't put my finger on what was strange at the time. Later, when I read the reviews, some people said it looked like a tombstone with a person's name on it. That's true.

The Eulogy of the Eulogy, the reflection of the reflection, the memorial ceremony. At least don't make the audience cry for nothing.
